newsitem.title: SPAIN: Telefonica shares stay firm after Q1 net.
newsitem.headline: Telefonica shares stay firm after Q1 net.

text.p: Shares in Spain's Telefonica de Espana remained firm on Monday, although first-quarter results were beneath expectations, dealers said.

"The immediate response after the announcement of results was negative, but money came right back in because the bourse is strong and an investment in Telefonica continues to be positive medium-term," a broker said.
Telefonica reported a rise of 15.7 percent in first-quarter net attributable profit to 27.87 billion pesetas, beneath the average expectation for a rise of some 20 percent.

At first, shares dropped to 3,965 pesetas from 3,980, but then quickly rebounded. At 1220 GMT, shares had risen to 3,985, but were still off an earlier all-time high of 4,010 pesetas seen before results were announced.
